forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South wind 14 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 57. South southeast wind 14 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
Downtown San Francisco is cloaked in a gentle, enveloping gray, a scene that resonates with the rhythm of rain tapping against the window panes—a solid reminder that nature is in command today. As the afternoon unfolds, periods of rain are anticipated, accompanied by a soft, south wind that dances through the streets, its gusts whispering an energetic yet calm reminder of the stormy skies above. Temperatures languish around the low sixties, steadily giving way to the cooler, more subdued tones of evening.

The visibility seems shrouded, the marine layer offering a veil across the iconic cityscape, where the outlines of buildings merge into a watercolor blurred with mist. It’s a day for comfort and warmth; bundling in a cozy sweater and a waterproof coat will be your companions if you venture outdoors. Perhaps a stroll through the nearby fog-kissed streets, seeking shelter in the intimate embrace of a café with a warming drink would be ideal. Alternatively, embracing the coziness of home with a good book or a favorite film feels most fitting as the rain serenades softly, creating a tranquil refuge from the bustling world outside.
